meanings.definition: To sell more of (something) than can be supplied or than exists
meanings.sent1: The store oversells the popular toy every holiday season.
meanings.sent2: The company often oversells its limited edition products, causing long waiting lists.
meanings.sent3: The magician oversells the disappearing act, making the audience expect real magic.
meanings.sent4: The salesman oversells the benefits of the product, leaving customers disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The auctioneer oversells the antique vase, driving up the bidding war.

meanings.definition: To present or describe (something) in a way that makes it seem better or more important than it really is
meanings.sent1: The advertisement oversells the benefits of the new diet pill.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent tends to oversell the small house as a luxurious mansion.
meanings.sent3: The comedian oversells his jokes, making them sound funnier than they are.
meanings.sent4: The author oversells the plot twist, leaving readers underwhelmed.
meanings.sent5: The travel brochure oversells the exotic destination, setting unrealistic expectations for tourists.
